name: Cook the Book: Chicken Saltimbocca
description: Saltimbocca literally means "jump in the mouth," and the classic Italian dish really is so delicious that it seems to leap off the plate and onto the tongue. Traditionally made from a cutlet of veal topped with prosciutto and pressed...
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 thin slice (about 1 1/2 ounce) prosciutto di Parma
2 tablespoons white wine or dry white vermouth

recipeInstructions.text: Lay the chicken on a cutting board and, if necessary, pound it lightly to an even thickness. Sprinkle ones side lightly with salt and pepper. Flip the fillet; arrange the sage leaves and then the prosciutto on top, pressing with your palm to make them adhere.

Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Carefully—so that the prosciutto doesn't fall off—lay the fillet prosciutto-side down in the skillet. When it has browned, after about 1 minute, turn and sear on the other side.
Reduce the heat to low and add the wine and about 2 tablespoons water. Partially cover and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
